description:
Temnothorax longispinosus is a species of ant belonging to the genus Temnothorax. These ants are small, typically measuring around 3-4 millimeters in length. They are known for their distinctive spiny appearance, with a pair of long, sharp spines projecting from the back of their thorax, which is the middle section of their body.

T. longispinosus ants are found in various parts of Europe, including parts of Central and Eastern Europe. They typically nest in small cavities, such as under rocks, in tree bark, or in the soil. These ants are known to be social, living in colonies that can range from a few individuals to several hundred.

The spines on the thorax of T. longispinosus are believed to serve as a defense mechanism, deterring predators and other potential threats. These ants are also known to exhibit complex social behaviors, including the use of chemical communication and the division of labor within the colony.

Overall, Temnothorax longispinosus is a fascinating species that provides insights into the diversity and adaptations of ants in their natural environments.
